topic.title: LINEOTN Overview

body.p: There are two datapaths through LINEOTN subsystem: OTU and FLEXO.

In the OTU datapath, the LINEOTN subsystem is responsible for interfacing to the device line SERDES interface through: DSI interface: OTL4.4/OTL4.2/OTLC.4/OTLC.2, Multi-lane distribution through OTL MLD engine, FEC encoding / decoding.

In the FLEXO datapath, the FLEXO block is responsible for interfacing to the device line SERDES interface through: DSI interface: FOIC1.4/FOIC1.2, FOIC MLD, FEC encoding / decoding, and FLEXO layer processing.

Both OTU and FLEXO datpath continue onto OTU (Optical Channel Transport Unit) termination, and interfacing to the COREOTN subsystem through a fast multichannel DCI bus. LINEOTN subsystem can process up to 600G of OTN traffic (OTU2, OTU2e, OTU1e, OTU4, OTU4+, OTUC).

The LINEOTN subsystem complies with the applicable sub-clauses of G.709, G.798, G.709.1, G.sup58, G.806, G.975 standards in processing data from the SERDES links through the MLD, FEC, and the FLEXO, OTUk and OTUCn layers.
The LINEOTN subsystem connects to DSIS lane mapping on the line side and COREOTN on the system side.
The LINEOTN covers 3 main layers of OTN processing: MLD, FEC, and FLEXO, or OTUk or OTUCn layer processing:

li.p: MLD layers supported within LINEOTN are:

ul.li: OTU datapath: OSTiG/OTUk_A (G.709 Annex C and 12/2017 version of G.798 16.3). OSTiG/OTUCn_A (12/2017 version of G.798 16.6). It also performs scrambling and frame alignment per OTSiG/OTUk_A (12/2017 version of G.798 16.3).
FLEXO datapath: FOIC1.2 and FOIC1.4 (ITU G.709.1 Clause 11)

li.p: The FECs supported within LINEOTN are:

ul.li: OTU datapath: the standard GFEC (also known as RSFEC, G.709 Annex A)
FLEXO datapath: RS(544,514) FEC per ITU G.709.1

li.p: For FLEXO datapath, there is FLEXO layer processing performs Descrambling and Scrambling (12/2017 version of G.798 16.8.2), FlexO trail termination (2/2017 version of G.798 15.2.1) and FlexO to OTUCn adaptation (2/2017 version of G.798 15.3). For both OTU and FLEXO datapath, the OTU layer processing performs multi-frame alignment and FAS/MFAS insertion per OSTiG/OTUk_A (12/2017 version of G.798 16.3), OTU_TT (G.798 13.2.1) and OTU/ODU_A (G.798 13.3.1).

body.p: The LINEOTN subsystem interfaces to the COREOTN subsystem using a multi-channel DCI. In the receive (ingress) direction, the multi-channel DCI is formed from individual line side SERDES links using an Interleaver block and a programmable scheduler which determines which line side link (channel) drives the DCI during a given clock cycle. In the transmit direction, the scheduling of clients on the DCI bus is dictated to the LINEOTN subsystem by the COREOTN subsystem, and individual line side links are disassembled from the incoming DCI using a De-Interleaver block.
The following subsections highlight key features of the blocks within the LINEOTN subsystem.
